translated: the Buddha’s son at that time.
the sandal I gave at that time,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the sandal.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā upāhanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai upāhanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the venerable Upāhanadāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Upāhanadāyaka’s Story is the sixth.
